title: What more we do
description: Our events are where it all happens. We meet to learn, create, consult, and sometimes just to have a drink and feel at home. Whether you're looking for an intense tech challenge or a chill evening of bar-side talks, we have a place for you.

eventTypes.title: DYKEATHON
eventTypes.description: 'We are here to make sure we have each other's backs.' Our mission is simple: to create a network that actually works for us. We don't wait for an invite to the table; we're building our own. This means:
features: Being the first point of contact: Whether you need a job referral, help prepping for an interview, or just want to talk through a professional dilemma with someone who truly gets it.
Opening the door: Helping anyone who wants to break into tech realize it's possible, and showing them the best way to get there.
No explanations needed: Creating events and meetups where our identity is the default, not something we have to justify or explain.

eventTypes.title: MEETUPS
eventTypes.description: Regular gatherings that keep our community connected. These are informal, low-pressure events where you can just show up, chat with other queer women in tech, share what you're working on, or just hang out.

eventTypes.title: DRINK & DYKE
eventTypes.description: Our casual, no-agenda bar nights. These events are all about unwinding, making friends, and enjoying a relaxed evening together.

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 2026
about: The Dykeathon is a 24-hour hackathon for queer women and non-binary people in tech. We come together to build, create, and make lasting connections — because we don't wait for an invite to the table; we build our own.

This year we're partnering with the LGBTQ+ Center in Tel Aviv to bring the community together for a day of innovation, challenge, and solidarity. Whether you're a developer, designer, product manager, or just curious about tech — there's a place for you here.
All skill levels are welcome. All we ask is that you show up ready to connect and create.

program.title: Doors Open & Registration
program.description: Coffee, breakfast, and mingling. Come early, meet your teammates.

program.title: Opening Ceremony
program.description: Welcome from the organizers, introduction to the challenge themes, and team formation.

program.title: Hacking Begins
program.description: Teams get to work. Mentors and experts available for consultation throughout the day.

program.title: Lunch Break
program.description: Shared lunch provided. Workshops and talks running in parallel.

program.title: Afternoon Sprint
program.description: Back to building. Mentorship continues, energy drinks provided.

program.title: Project Presentations
program.description: Each team presents their project to the judges and the community. 5 minutes per team.

program.title: Judging & Awards
program.description: Judges deliberate. Winners announced across multiple categories.

program.title: Closing Party
program.description: We celebrate together. Drinks, dancing, and the dyke network growing stronger.

tracks.title: Community Tech
tracks.description: Build tools that serve the LGBTQ+ community — apps, platforms, or services that address real needs.

tracks.title: Career & Mentorship
tracks.description: Create resources for queer women breaking into tech — job boards, peer support systems, mentorship platforms.

tracks.title: Open Challenge
tracks.description: Build anything that excites your team. We're here for creativity and ambition.
